Are you on 32 bit linux? Did you just sync for the first time or was your node running before? 
If so maybe your node was not shutdown correctly which might fry the database. Did the node run out of memory or was the harddisk full?

Sorry there hasn't been a lot of action on this. I can't really figure out the specifics needed to trigger this, but I suspect it has something to do with the background freezer using a threshold, and the threshold is modified by the downloader. So while the downloader resets the threshold to a smaller value (due to the failed syncs), the freezer does not immediately read the new value. 

And that leads to a `errOutOrderInsertion`. 

Since we've had no other similar reports, I'll close this and hope that it's fixed with the changes in the downloader since 1.9.15. Please reopen if it happens again.
